title: Topica Edtech Group
text:
Topica Edtech Group () is a multinational educational technology company. It provides online education including bachelor's degree programs (<a href="Topica%20Uni">Topica Uni</a>), English speech tutoring courses (<a href="Topica%20Native">Topica Native</a>) and technology platform for <a href="Massive%20open%20online%20course">massive online open courses</a> in a variety of fields (<a href="Edumall">Edumall</a>).
Topica Edtech Group headquartered in <a href="Hanoi">Hanoi</a>, <a href="Vietnam">Vietnam</a> and has expanded into the <a href="Philippines">Philippines</a>, <a href="Singapore">Singapore</a>, <a href="Thailand">Thailand</a>, <a href="Indonesia">Indonesia</a> and the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>.
History.
In April 2004, a group of professors in the <a href="Centre%20for%20Research%20and%20Consulting%20on%20Management">Centre for Research and Consulting on Management</a>, <a href="Hanoi%20University%20of%20Science%20and%20Technology">Hanoi University of Science and Technology</a>, initiated an Online Training Program and International Cooperation named <a href="CRC-TOPIC">CRC-TOPIC</a>. The entrepreneurship incubator project received financial support by <a href="InfoDev">Infodev</a>.
In 2006, <a href="Microsoft">Microsoft</a> Chairman, <a href="Bill%20Gates">Bill Gates</a> and the <a href="Deputy%20prime%20minister">Deputy Prime Minister</a> of <a href="Vietnam">Vietnam</a>, <a href="Ph%E1%BA%A1m%20Gia%20Khi%C3%AAm">Pham Gia Khiem</a>, launched <a href="TOPIC64">TOPIC64</a> as an E-learning infrastructure development project in 64 provinces of Vietnam. <a href="Qualcomm">Qualcomm</a> announced that it was a one sponsor of the project, besides <a href="Microsoft%20Windows">Microsoft</a>, <a href="Hewlett-Packard">Hewlett Packard</a> and <a href="United%20States%20Agency%20for%20International%20Development">USAID</a>.
In 2007, <a href="TOPIC64">TOPIC64</a> and <a href="MIT">MIT</a> Professor <a href="Charles%20Leiserson">Charles Leiserson</a> launched the Boston-Hanoi online course "Intro to Algorithms" for 30 Vietnamese students.
In 2008, Topica Edtech Group was founded as an education technology company whose mission is to promote high-quality online education among learners in Vietnam and South East Asia.
At the same time, following <a href="Harvard%20University">Harvard</a>, <a href="Stanford%20University">Stanford</a>, <a href="MIT">MIT</a> and <a href="Duke%20University">Duke University</a>, Topica Edtech Group applied 3D simulation technology in teaching. This brought a realistic experience in virtual 3D space.
In 2010, the company organized an online training course on <a href="Business%20incubator">Business Incubator</a> for 105 managers from 15 <a href="Asia-Pacific">Asia-Pacific</a> countries.
In 2011, <a href="Topica%20Founder%20Institute">Topica Founder Institute</a> (TFI) launched the first batch of startup accelerator from <a href="Silicon%20Valley">Silicon Valley</a> in Vietnam.
In 2013, the company launched mobile learning app Topica Mobile in Vietnam.
In 2014, they launched Online English speech tutoring platform <a href="Topica%20Native">Topica Native</a> (TOPMITO) allowing students speaking via <a href="Google%20Glass">Google Glass</a> with native speakers.
Until 2016, Topica Edtech Group has partnered with 11 universities across the <a href="Philippines">Philippines</a>, <a href="Vietnam">Vietnam</a> and the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>.
In April, 2016, according to an article in <a href="https%3A//e27.co/">E27</a>, Topica Edtech Group signed a partnership deal with <a href="Coursera">Coursera</a>. Through this pact, one of Topica's partners in Vietnam - <a href="Vinh%20University">Vinh University</a> - recognized credits from some of Coursera’s 1,800 online courses.
Courses.
Topica Edtech Group offers online bachelor's degree programs, online English speech tutoring and training courses in a variety of topics. Each course often includes visual elements, such as lecture video, animations and graphics, online textbook and a mini test at the end of each lesson. Instructors and course participants can interact with each other in discussion forums. All elements of the courses can be viewed at any time and in any wireless devices whenever the Internet connection is available.
In 2008, it integrated <a href="3D%20technology">3D technology</a> called “<a href="Second%20Life">Second Life</a>”, where students can walk around and interact inside that 3D virtual environment into online bachelor's degree program (<a href="Topica%20Uni">Topica Uni</a>). It has cooperated with 11 universities in <a href="Vietnam">Vietnam</a>, the <a href="Philippines">Philippines</a> and the <a href="United%20States">United States</a> to provide online <a href="bachelor%27s%20degree">bachelor's degree</a> in <a href="business%20administration">business administration</a>, <a href="accounting">accounting</a>, <a href="finance%20and%20banking">finance and banking</a>, <a href="information%20technology">information technology</a>, <a href="law">law</a> and economy law. Beside academic lecture video, the participants could also learn practical knowledge and experience from successful entrepreneurs.
In 2014, Topica also supplied <a href="TOPMITO">TOPMITO</a> (or <a href="Topica%20Native">Topica Native</a>), an Online English speech tutoring platform through <a href="Google%20Glass">Google Glass</a>, computers, and mobile devices. Course participants could choose different study paths with English native teachers. The course utilized the English ability testing system <a href="CASEC">CASEC</a>, initiated based on research of <a href="Society%20for%20Testing%20English%20Proficiency">STEP</a> and developed by <a href="Japan%20Institute%20for%20Educational%20Measurement">Japan Institute for Educational Measurement</a> (JIEM) in order to evaluate participant’s progression.
In March 2016, Topica invited professors and experts to put their courses on its online platform (<a href="Edumall">Edumall</a>). The courses mostly covered <a href="Information%20Technology">Information Technology</a>, <a href="Personal%20development">Personal Development</a>, <a href="Business%20and%20Startup">Business and Startup</a>, <a href="Design">Design</a>, <a href="Marketing">Marketing</a>, <a href="Office%20software">Office Software</a> and <a href="English%20language">English</a>.
Business Accelerator.
According to <a href="http%3A//www.dealstreetasia.com/">Deal Street Asia</a>, <a href="Topica%20Founder%20Institute">Topica Founder Institute</a> (TFI) is an early-stage startup accelerator. It is a batch of startup accelerator from Silicon Valley which has run in 40 countries. In 2010, it organized a training course on Business Incubation for 105 managers from 15 Asia-Pacific countries.
After 3 years, it incubated quite a number of technology startups, the most notable of which was <a href="Appota">Appota</a>, which raised a series B round April, 2014.
